subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: I have a question.
author: April Abercrombie
full_text:
------=_NextPart_000_00DF_01C9D922.04C9F6B0
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Yeah Adobe Audition is definitely the best for the job.

I just meant that =
even the best out there isn't perfect, meaning no matter what, you cannot c=
lean up a clip without affecting the parts you want to keep as well. So the=
 more you clean up, the more distorted the good parts get.

I just don't th=
ink it is possible for any software to isolate specific parts apart from th=
e background. Generally, Adobe is better at it, because it has the comparis=
on tool where you can select certain things you want to reduce. But even so=
, the parts you don't want reduced will still be affected.

----- Original =
Message ----- 
  From: Carol B. 
  To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Wed=
nesday, May 20, 2009 8:09 AM
  Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: I have a question=
.





  I use Adobe Audition...99 per cent of the time the procedure I use=
 to
  "clean up" evp's is this...I amplify...then I will use the graphic
  =
equalizer preset on vocal presence....occasionally I use the slow down...

=
  This works really well for me....I'm just saying,
  Carol B.

  > The pro=
blem with it Jim is that there is no way to "clean" the audio
  > without e=
ffecting the stuff you want to keep as well. At least not with
  > the chea=
py softwares. I head the Adobe Audition is much better at it, but
  > still=
 not perfect.
  >
  > But again, enhance all you want, just make sure you k=
eep the original
  > unaltered.
  >
  > ----- Original Message -----
  > Fr=
om: James W. Hyslope
  > To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
  > Sent: Tuesday, May=
 19, 2009 7:11 PM
  > Subject: [EVP-ITC] Re: I have a question.
  >
  >
  >=

  >
  >
  > Well, for myself...I don't "clean" them up to much because I r=
eally
  > don't know HOW :) (well a little bit)Since I've only been at it f=
or a
  > couple weeks. BUT if you can clean up something to where you can F=
IND
  > what was there to begin with "you have done no harm" I hear alot mo=
re
  > than others I guess, and I haven't enhanced many of my evp's.*If any=
one
  > is able to clean them up...I DO promise you will hear what I say is=

  > correct)Pretty BOLD statement, but if you are able to clean it up with=

  > better software (please do for others too) I will be more than happy t=
o
  > "listen" where I made a mistake...I can only LEARN from it :) I have
=
  > done some DEEP enhancements to a few of my evp's...from the begining I
=
  > could only hear clicks and thumps.....but after messing with that area,=

  > eventually I would hear the true voices (and can tell if male or
  > f=
emale...approximate age) and understand the mood also....these where
  > ex=
treamly modified, and I feel that I could NOT have added enough
  > "simple=
" enhancements that would ADD a voice....full of emotion and
  > distinct s=
yllables :) And some just can't hear them for what ever reason
  > be it eq=
uipment that is used to hear (pc-headphones-speakers-ears) know
  > one has=
 the perfect match of all these things. Check out "Jim's RR-DR60
  > EVP's"=
 in the files section....work them over till you hear them. I
  > really ca=
n't do much more :)--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, Eric
  > VanDuzer <evand=
uzer@...> wrote:
  > >
  > > Now I may be biased to the "investigation" way=
 of doing things. I do
  > clean
  > > up evps if I hear something and can'=
t make it out do to ambient noise.
  > So
  > > hear is my question. When d=
o you stop cleaning up? Wouldn't to much
  > > enhancing "taint" the result=
s? To me the more enhancing you do the
  > less
  > > convincing it becomes=
. I hope noone finds this offensive, it is not
  > meant
  > > to be I am j=
ust really curious. The way I look at it is that if you
  > have to
  > > d=
o so much enhancing to find anything, was there really something
  > there =
to
  > > begin with. Are we just making ourselves believe there is somethin=
g
  > there??
  > >
  > > Eric
  > >
  >
  >
  >
  >
